clinical_study.brief_title: Soy Isoflavone Tablets: Effects on Sleep, Quality of Life, Symptoms and Cognitive Function in Menopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: Soy Isoflavone Tablets: Effects on Questionnaire and Actigraphic Measures of Sleep, Symptoms as Measured by the Women's Health Questionnaire and Cognitive Function as Measured by Computerized Cognitive Performance Tests in Menopausal Women

brief_summary.textblock: The study was done to elucidate relationships between midlife women's self-reported hot flashes, neuropsychological symptoms, cognitive performance or sleep.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Soy Isoflavone: Effects on Sleep, Symptoms, Quality of Life and Cognitive Function in Menopausal Women
primary_outcome.description: Hot flashes recorded by means of 5 global estimation and daily diary measures of hot flashes and night sweats.

primary_outcome.measure: Soy Isoflavone: Effects on Sleep, Symptoms, Quality of Life and Cognitive Function in Menopausal Women
primary_outcome.description: Symptoms recorded on the Women's Health Questionniare at baseline and 4 subsequent occasions

primary_outcome.measure: Soy Isoflavone Tablets: Effects on Sleep, Quality of Life, Symptoms and Cognitive Function in Menopausal Women
primary_outcome.description: Subjective sleep measured by average questionnaire item scores recorded each morning for a week, repeated at baseline and 4 subsequent times

primary_outcome.measure: Soy Isoflavone Tablets: Effects on Sleep, Quality of Life, Symptoms and Cognitive Function in Menopausal Women
primary_outcome.description: Cognitive function measured by computerized cognitive performance tests of motor speed, switching attention, continuous performance and Stroop color-word tests.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- At least 5 hot flash episodes and/or night sweats per 24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) more than 34 kg/m2
- Hypertension
- Shift work
- Psychiatric or medical conditions that would affect outcome measures
- More than 4 caffeine drinks per day
- More than 10 cigarettes per day
- More than than 7 alcohol drinks per week
